meanings.definition: To type or enter text before it is needed or used.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys pretyping her emails the night before to save time in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I always pretype my passwords to avoid any mistakes when logging in.
meanings.sent3: The student was caught pretyping the answers to the test, thinking the teacher wouldn't notice.
meanings.sent4: His habit of pretyping messages made him the fastest texter among his friends.
meanings.sent5: Pretyping can be a useful skill for increasing typing speed and efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of predicting or anticipating what will be typed or entered next.
meanings.sent1: Her pretyping of the document showed her ability to anticipate the information needed.
meanings.sent2: The pretyping feature on the software helps users input text more quickly.
meanings.sent3: The pretyping contest at the office party was surprisingly competitive.
meanings.sent4: His pretyping skills were so accurate that it seemed like he could read minds.
meanings.sent5: The pretyping exercise in class helped students improve their typing accuracy.
